sv:property.sv:value: A supplier of energy is looking for a Account Manager to be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships within the retail market. This will involve pricing of offers to customers and negotiating contract margins.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Business Development
  • Develop new relationships with TPIs in the energy market
  • Establish a portfolio of customers through key TPI’s and direct with the company in order to achieve gross margin and volume targets
  • Manage pricing of tenders / quotes following company processes – to include credit procedures, set up processes
  • Implement retention and business development strategies as agreed with Retail Manager with key TPI’s and direct customers
  • Assist in identifying and developing new sales channels

Relationship Management

  • Ongoing, effective management of existing TPI’s and customers ensuring accurate set up and pricing operations
  • Devise account plans to maximise retention and value with customer base
  • Ensure queries are resolved to a satisfactory level, liaising with colleagues and other departments where appropriate.

Retail Team Support

  • Train retail staff in pricing operations and become pricing system expert
  • Provide monthly sales reporting detailing activity, results and forecasts
  • Work closely with colleagues to achieve team targets
  • Product Development
  • Assist Commercial / Marketing in the development of new products in order to deliver business plan targets (growth, margin, risk management)
  • Provide accurate feedback on sales and pricing activity

Outcome, Results and Key Performance Indicators:

  • Develop relationships with brokers and direct customers
  • Plan and achieve new business and renewal targets in line with business plan
  • Ensure contractual information and related customer supply information / documentation is collected and completed in line with business procedures
  • Ensure systems are updated and used in accordance with latest business procedures
  • Provide regular and structured market feedback including competitor information
  • Grow the green market

The Facilities Supervisor will be responsible for supporting the company's overall facilities function and carrying out facility maintenance duties. This position reports to and works closely with the Facilities Supervisor or Designee in accomplishing routine objectives & comprehensive goals.

Responsibilities include:

  • As directed by the Facilities Supervisor or Designee, assist in the implementation and installments of facilities quality systems and practices to minimize production downtime and ensure safety standards.
  • Perform operations activities necessary to keep complex facilities systems operating without interruption.
  • Perform building maintenance and repairs to provide for employee safety and productivity.
  • Perform preventive and corrective maintenance on all facilities systems as directed by the Facilities Supervisor or Designee.
  • Assist with tracking and implementing correct trade specific codes, policies, and best practices for a variety of disciplines in Facilities.
  • Develop and implement improved practices for plumbing, electrical, pipe fitting, HVAC, fire protection, chemical and gas handling, waste treatment, and IT implementation.
  • Assist in the generation and continual improvement of facilities department operations and maintenance procedures.
  • Track, chart and record facility equipment conditions and parameters to ensure that they are operating efficiently.
  • Carry out facilities modifications, as directed by the Facilities Supervisor or Designee.
  • Assist with the inspection and installation process for the Evergreen facilities.
  • Support various departments with maintenance, repairs, renovations and construction activities.
  • May perform duties requiring trades license or wastewater treatment certification.

This is a direct hire position in the San Francisco, CA area. You will need a BSEE and 5+ years of engineering and consulting experience with Solar Energy projects. You should have good technical knowledge of Solar Energy Technologies. Great opportunity with an industry leader. Great benefits including relocation assistance.

Responsibilities

  • The position will involve a wide variety of diverse assignments including resource assessment, due diligence, siting, feasibility studies, new technology evaluation, project proposal evaluation, market assessments, strategic planning, policy evaluation, and pro forma economic analysis
  • Interact with clients including utilities, energy project developers, financial institutions, energy end-users, investors, government agencies, and other organizations
  • Primary responsibilities will include leading and contributing to authorship of reports, studies, and proposals
  • Develop technical and economic analyses of projects and technologies using models built in Microsoft Excel
  • Identify and understand client issues, and work collaboratively to develop and communicate creative solutions
  • Assess regulatory, technical, and market issues to evaluate competitive dynamics of various resource options
  • Manage data and prepare periodic analysis updates. Perform research including literature reviews, telephone calls, and internet-based research

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Vacation and Holiday pay
  • 401k matching
  • Annual bonus potential
  • Relocation assistance, and more

ERM is seeking an energetic, self-starting Project Manager, Impact Assessment and Planning (IAP) Consultant in our St.​ Paul, MN office to support and grow the international Impact Assessment & Planning (IAP) practice.​

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  • Services within our IAP Practice include environmental impact assessment, land planning, facility siting & permitting, risk assessment and water resources management
  • Provide support to technical staff for Contaminated Site Management Practice regarding natural resources damages and ecological and human health risk assessment
  • Direct multiple IAP projects for a variety of clients, particularly those in the utility, brownfields, alternative energy, and water resource sectors
  • Serve as Project Manager for multi-media permitting and compliance associated with development projects.
  • Serve as a Project Manager for NEPA environmental assessments (EAs) and environmental impact statements (EISs) projects and related activities in support of ERM clients’ development projects, with a primary focus on oil and gas, power generation, electrical transmission, and renewable energy projects. Specific expertise should include leading preparation of EAs/ EISs and associated management plans in compliance with NEPA
  • Contribute to proposal development for ERM’s IAP practice, including development of technical scopes and cost estimates
  • Direct and monitor project management activities related to impact assessment projects, which can be expected to include: task delegation and direction, subcontractor management, health & safety protocol management, monitoring of commercial performance, deliverable quality review, and interaction with clients
  • Contribute to preparing impact assessment deliverables, serving in roles ranging from lead technical expert to quality review.   Project delivery activities can be expected to include: report writing, undertaking and organizing data collection and survey field work, data and literature review, and development of recommendations for clients
  • Collaborate with other ERM IAP practitioners to execute impact assessment projects. In this regard, the position will entail participation on teams comprised of impact assessment professionals from multiple offices around the organization
  • Mentor junior-level and mid-level consulting staff (including experienced impact assessment staff, as well as staff with introductory levels of impact assessment experience) to develop their skill sets in the IAP practice area.

Californians lead the nation in energy efficiency—and VERENGO leads the way in providing solar solutions to homeowners throughout Southern California.​ We install only the most intelligent, energy-efficient and dependable products available while providing unsurpassed customer service and workmanship.​ PLUS, in addition to solar panel installation, Verengo offers a range of other energy-saving products—to help you conserve the energy that your solar system generates.​

Due to growth, we are currently seeking Solar Sales Consultants to join our Sales team. We are looking for candidates who are committed to bringing our values to life:
We do ‘good’ AND we do ‘well’.

  • Through our success, we show that doing well and doing good are not mutually exclusive.
  • We are socially responsible and financially successful.

 We are ALL salespeople.

  • To succeed, we must act responsibly, treat customers with respect, build trust and deliver results.
  • It is management’s job to set our people up to succeed at these moments of trust through training and the right processes.

HAPPY employees lead to HAPPY customers.

  • Success starts with great employees.
  • If we are not happy, we cannot make our customers happy.

General Summary

Solar Sales Consultants are responsible for driving the growth and profitability of the company through customizing the design of each customer’s solar system to meet that customer’s unique needs.

Overall accountability for the day to day success of the execution of the project.​Provide key leadership in planning, engineering, project controls, procurement, construction, and start-up of the projects to deliver high quality, low cost and reliable power generation that meet or exceed proforma requirements. Reports to the Senior Director as an integral member of the Engineering & Construction Project

Responsibilities:
  • Ensures on-time completion of all project accountabilities including but not limited to operating performance in reliability/ availability, Output, Ramp Rates, SU/ SD time, O&M cost, fuel, water, major maintenance, capital cost and construction schedule
  • Conduct business through a comprehensive understanding of how plants are constructed, operated and maintained and the ability to effectively identify the prevent, mitigate or resolve critical issues that will impact cost and performance
  • Build an integrated geographically dispersed highly productive project engineering and construction team of employees, project specialists and contractors and effectively leverage limited resources
  • Establish clear, effective, results oriented vision for project team by effectual communication of the vision, set effective expectations that continually challenge and up-grade skills and competencies to meet evolving opportunities to improve results
  • Offer process focused, disciplined direction to the site execution team during the planning phase of projects thru effective deployment of engineering and construction technical standards
  • Demonstrates a bias for action, makes timely decisions and takes actions with an uncompromising commitment to maintain excellence in technical/ functional accountability
  • Utilize ability to effectively and constructively challenge status quo, recognize value drivers, and lead the drive to maximize value and quality in technical/ operational awareness
  • Provide performance management of project team members by setting and achieving stretch goals through effective direction, coaching and feedback to drive down the total cost of ownership and increase productivity
  • Develop effective process for identifying, analyzing and integrating critical lessons learned into standards

Solar Cookers International (SCI) in Sacramento, California is a mostly volunteer organization, and the spread of solar cooking is basically people-to-people. That's why you can make a difference in many ways. Thanks in advance for doing your part.
Seeking volunteers: Solarcooking - what can you do

Here is how you can participate:

  • Educate yourself - Read the documents presented here in the Solar Cookers World Network possibly starting with Introduction to solar cooking.
  • Build your own solar cooker and become proficient in cooking with it.
  • Become an advocate - Introduce solar cooking to people who can encourage its spread to the people who need it most. Urge leaders and policy makers to support sustainable energy solutions. See our article on promoting solar cooking. Talk about it every chance you get. Any time someone says "how've you been" or "what have you been up to?" you have an opening. Learn to use those openings.
  • Donate to Solar Cookers International:
    • Become a member - Our work depends on support from people like you. See How to become a member of SCI.
    • Offset your carbon footprint by providing solar cookers to people in developing countries who need them.
    • Donate your car - Donate your car using this form or call call toll free (877) 227-7487 extension 2403.
    • Use your iPhone to download this new application The ChancetoGive Foundation selected Solar Cookers International as one of the charities that will receive donations from the application's users.
    • Capital One SCI Credit Card Apply for a SCI credit card through Capital One. SCI earns 25 dollars for each approved application and 1% of your purchases each quarter. To place this banner on your site, insert the code from this document into your site: Code for SCI credit card banner
    • Good Search / Good Shop- Search the web with GoodSearch.com and each time you do a search, GoodSearch will donate a penny to our cause! Shop online at GoodShop.com and a percentage of each purchase will be donated to our cause! More than 600 top stores are participating including Amazon, Target, Staples, Best Buy and more! Code for inserting a Good Shop banner
    • Fun(d)-raising - Your group or community can support SCI, be listed in our newsletter as an organizational member, AND have fun too. Creative events people have organized include community Solarbrations, Sol Food pot-lucks and Sun Runs. Please see these ways that schools and young people have raised money for our work.
    • Sell items on Ebay! SCI is a certified charity on Ebay, which means you can help fundraise for us. Visit our EBay charity page for more information.
    • Donate to SOLAR COOKERS INTERNATIONAL with the Capital One No Hassle Giving Site.
  • Contribute to the Solar Cookers World Network, - Add to an existing article or create a new one. If you are new to wikis, check out the Tutorial, and then be bold and jump in! Questions? Write to Tom Sponheim at webmaster@solarcooking.org. Here is our list of tasks that need doing.
  • Friend-raising - Help your friends become friends of SCI. If each of us gets one new member, our strength and activities can double.
  • Solar cooking demonstrations - at public events, for school children and youth groups, for special friends in your home. With advance notice, SCI can send display photos and brochures by surface mail. Remember, though organized demonstrations are a very good thing, demonstrations can be informal as well. If you picnic in a park and use one or more solar cookers to prepare your meal, you are demonstrating. If you have the choice at home, and security is not a big issue, cook where people will see your cookers as they drive or walk by. There are many ways to "demonstrate." Giving out small samples of delicious suncooked foods is yet another way of demonstrating.
  • Direct participation - There are ways to directly participate in such training; solar cooking and building skills are desirable but not essential. These opportunities generally require that you pay your own travel and living expenses as well as contribute to the project costs. For more information on this, contact Solar Cookers International directly.
  • Join the discussion forums and discuss solar cooking topics with people around the world.
  • Participate in research.
  • Translate educational materials - If you can offer assistance in translating pages, please contact Tom Sponheim at webmaster@solarcooking.org.
  • Add a link to the Solar Cookers World Network wiki-based site on Facebook or other web pages.
  • Buy books - Enter Amazon.com via this link and 10% of your purchases will be donated to Solar Cookers International. This is possible via the Amazon Associates Program and a matching grant from Microsoft.
  • Get friends, family, and community members suncooking- Once you've made yourself some cookers, make some to give away as gifts, preferably with one or more suitable pots or cooking jars, an oven bag (if needed), and some instructions for use. Make some more to donate to raffles or auctions for environmental or humanitarian causes. People who cook with sun are more likely to promote suncooking enthusiastically. If you help the people around you to get suncooking it will help the whole world get there.
  • Write About It! - You do not necessarily have to be a professional writer to get an article into small publications. Many communities have a free paper that is primarily want ads but also includes small articles of seasonal or local interest. Such publications might welcome a small article on the joys of solar cooking or instructions for making and using a simple solar cooker. Do you belong to an organization that has a newsletter? Can you get a small piece about the work that SCI or SHE are doing into your church newsletter? Do you work for a company that has an in-house newsletter that might welcome a contribution? What other opportunities can you find? Consider whether it is a publication that would prefer an article slanted towards hands-on use of the technology or one that details some of the humanitarian or environmental aspects of solar cooking. Do your best to write clearly and simply, using proper spelling and grammar to the best of your ability. Include the url for SCA so readers know where to go for further information. Proof carefully before submitting your piece, and if you find you really enjoy writing about solar cooking and would like to improve your writing skills and try for bigger markets with wider readerships (these will also pay you for writing!), you can get lots of free writing help at Forward Motion Writers.

Groups involved in promoting solar cooking need to share more information, collaborate more and pool their voices to be heard by opinion-makers and decision-makers who could provide more resources to support the spread of solar cooking. Fostering these objectives is part of Solar Cookers World Network's mission. We're looking for a lobbyist for solar cooking.

What does the job entail?

 NGOs involved in other development work should consider whether solar cooking and the Integrated Cooking Method would make useful additions to their projects. Governments that currently inhibit the spread of solar cooking by heavily taxing imports of solar-related supplies while also subsidizing fossil fuel imports need to re-evaluate their thinking. Forward thinking businesses have a role to play by investing in the not-quite-yet-emerging solar cooker market, creating more manufacturing, distribution and sales facilities, and participating in spreading awareness. Schools can become involved in teaching solar cooking--both as a tool for teaching science concepts and as a practical matter of survival and home economics.

Where does this job take me? 

To a degree, these things are happening. Malawi has a renewable energy component in its school curriculum. Senegal has appointed a person to spearhead solar cooking work in the country. At least one government agency in The Gambia is charged with teaching solar cooking. There are other examples of small, seriously underfunded steps being made. Much more will have to be done. Many believe that there will be a tipping point where a critical mass of awareness in the right circles will greatly speed up the spread of solar cooking.

The conditions to bring about this tipping point seem to be forming currently. Food and fuel prices have doubled recently in many poor countries. Also some countries have recently reduced or removed their subsidies on cooking fuel. For example, in April 2008 the Indonesian government announced a reduction of fuel subsidies. As a result, the cost of kerosene, used for cooking, rose from 700 rupiah per liter to 2,000 rupiah, an increase of 186%.[1].

It is also important to understand that often solar cooking is best introduced as part of an Integrated Cooking Method where solar cooking is combined with heat-retention cooking (where food is heated to boiling for a short time at which point the cooking pot before being placed in an insulated box or basket to continue cooking) and simple fuel-efficient wood stoves. Soaking beans or even slightly sprouting whole grains and pulses/legumes[2], in addition to enhancing digestibility and nutritional values, will shorten cooking times, resulting in more efficient use of sun and fuel.

Dr. Dieter Seifert has pointed out that in most parts of the world, to cook a pot of beans, people put the dry beans and the cooking water into a pot and cook it over a wood fire for four hours. If people learn that they can soak the beans overnight first, they can save two hours worth of fuelwood. They save an additional one and a half hours of fuelwood if they learn to heat the soaked beans over a fire or in a solar cooker until the beans have boiled for 10-15 minutes. They can then put the pot into an insulated basket where it will continue to cook for 3-4 hours without using any fuel. The heat-retention cooker can be as simple as a basket filled with dry grass or hay. We should all consider the value of such simple changes before one launching into anything more complicated.

Personal development 

On the personal and local level, if you enjoy and benefit from using the sun to cook, talk to people about it. Talk to friends, family, teachers, students, store clerks, people you might sit next to on a bus or stand next to in a line at a store. If you carry copies of a small Universal Leaflet, you will have something to give to anyone who shows an interest, to direct them to further information.

Web designers are responsible for creating the look and feel of World Wide Web pages for a client's Web site. This involves developing a graphic design that effectively communicates the ideas being promoted by the Web site.

A web designer may take part in the initial planning of a Web site, meeting with the client to discuss ideas for the layout and organization of the site, the types of colors or images to use (photos, illustrations, videos, etc.), and other matters concerning overall graphic design. Sometimes a web producer has already developed a basic concept for the web page. In this case it is the web designer's task to create a design that matches the producer's ideas.

Web designers typically have a background in fine arts, graphic design, or publishing combined with college courses in computer science and hands-on computer experience. A web designer may have a four-year college degree, a two-year associate's degree, or perhaps no advanced schooling at all. Many web designers teach themselves HTML and acquire other necessary computer skills on their own.

All designers must have training in computer graphics packages such as Dreamweaver, Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Paint Shop Pro as well as knowledge of Flash, XML-based web applications and programming, XHTML programming, and other web development languages and technologies. The designer should also be comfortable working with a variety of operating systems such as Windows, Macintosh, and Unix. Since computer technology changes rapidly, web designers must constantly stay abreast of new developments in graphics software packages as well as those in the World Wide Web and related technologies.

The HTML Writers Guild offers web training and a certification program. There are four web study certification levels offered: Web Technologies, Web Programming, Web Graphics and Multimedia, and Web Business. Students must pass the web study courses before obtaining certification.
Getting the Job

As more companies develop their own Web sites, web designer openings can be found in classified ads in local newspapers, magazines, and on the Internet itself. Quite often, web designers begin their careers as graphic designers or layout artists for advertising firms or publishing companies. After learning the appropriate computer skills, they can transfer their artistic experience to the online world.

Prospective web designers should put together a portfolio of their work to show to potential employers. Many web designers are freelancers who sell their services to clients on a consulting or contractual basis. Self-employed web designers often establish a personal page on the World Wide Web that showcases their design skills for potential customers.
Advancement Possibilities and Employment Outlook

There are several different career paths available in the field of web design. The entry-level position of assistant designer involves designing certain elements of a web page or Web site. Project managers are in charge of the design or redesign of entire Web sites. The project manager may work with freelance artists and writers who supply materials to be incorporated into the Web site. Design directors oversee the work of a number of web designers, reviewing and correcting it and making suggestions to improve the design. A design director is usually the person who meets most often with the client to discuss ideas and make sure a project meets the client's expectations.

The Project Manager, Information Technology will plan and deliver successful enterprise level applications and technology projects by working closely with business leaders and end user organizations throughout the company, technology vendors, and internal/​external IT resources.​

He/ she will manage scope, business community expectations, and change management activities, as well as project plans, resources, and budget for assigned projects. The Project Manager will manage the full project life cycle from initiation through implementation, transitioning on-going support to appropriate internal or external resource. He/ she may be expected to manage multiple projects at the same time.

 

Working Conditions: 

80% of time is spent in the office environment, utilizing computers, servers, peripheral equipment, phones, and general office equipment. 20% of the time is spent traveling outside of the office to other locations or vendor locations located in the US, Canada and Mexico, for the purpose of project related work, and to attend conferences, trade shows, and professional development events.

Responsibilities:

  • Consults with business leaders and reviews project proposals to clearly identify business objectives and measurable goals, expected schedule, funding limitations, procedures for accomplishing the project, staffing requirements and allotment of resources
  • Plans, directs and coordinates activities in order to ensure project goals are accomplished within defined scope, time, and cost constraints
  • Formulates and defines technical approach of the project, in conjunction with other senior IT resources
  • Identifies and schedules project deliverables, milestones and required tasks
  • Coordinates recruitment or assignment of required project personnel and assigns duties.
  • Works with external vendors, as applicable, according to Statement of Work in order to implement the project according to plan
  • Establishes procedures for project reporting and documentation
  • Manages change control and issue escalation processes
  • Coordinates on-going project communication to all stakeholders and participants
  • Identifies and managing project risks proactively and responsively
  • Defines and insures the maintenance of technical and project documentation
  • Oversees the development of test plans and directs quality assurance testing activities

Testing plays an important role in development of new IT programmes and many every day products, like cars, games consoles and electronic goods. There's a saying in the industry that behind every great software developer is an equally great tester. This is because once a product reaches a certain point in its development the developers must hand it over to the tester to see if it works (or doesn't work) as it's meant to.

It's your job to work as hard as you can to 'break' the new product to help the design process. You'll work closely with software designers and programme managers to understand more about what each product is meant to do, its key features and who will use it.
Then you'll run functional tests, customer scenario testing, stress testing, performance testing, scalability testing and international testing. The ultimate goal is to iron out any bugs and improve the quality of the finished product.

 

You'll often be working on more than one project at a time, one product in first phase testing and another in its second or final phase. This means you'll work around the demands of the project rather than the clock.

If you're documenting the tests your typical working hours will be a 9am to 5pm day, but if you're running tests then it might be longer.
Skills and interests

Software experience and knowledge is a given to work as a software tester. You'll also need to be tactful and diplomatic to maintain a good working relationship with the software developers whose months of hard work you'll be picking apart.

 

Other skills that employers will look for include:

  • A natural curiosity
  • A good understanding of the software development process
  • A good understanding of the business approach
  • Good judgment skills
  • Good writing skills (for documenting the process)
  • Good communications and consultancy skills
  • The ability to work in a team and as an individual
  • Good presentation skills
  • The ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines

Hippo is looking for an experienced Product Consultant who would like to work in a dynamic and international environment. Do you have a passion for open source software? Do you enjoy learning about new technology, discussing innovative ideas with your peers, coming up with great customer solutions and passing on your knowledge to others frequently? Do you love to work in different teams, with customers, partners and our own product development team?

To realize the growth ambitions of Hippo we are searching for experienced Product Consultants who can inspire potential costumers with their expertise and enthusiasm. As a Product Consultant you will help our growing customer base, with your broad knowledge of technologies and frameworks, to get the most out of open source solutions, and more specific Hippo's products.

Because of the major impact of Open Standards on Content Management & Portal technology, Hippo is actively involved in the specification of several Java Specification Request (JSR) standards. Hippo has a vast number of employees participating in open source projects within the Apache Software Foundation. This role will give you the opportunity to work closely with some open source veterans and to pimp your open source resume.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • Liaise with clients regarding new projects;
  • advise clients on the use of open source software and standards;
  • help clients with product evaluation and implementation;
  • estimate workload and costs for the potential projects;
  • Prepare and present demos to interested clients;
  • Develop awesome new plug-ins front to back;
  • translate business requirements to technical solutions and document best practices;
  • Provide internal and external training to expand knowledge on Hippo products;
  • blog/ communicate about Hippo product range;
  • Assist external developers with their projects and offer them hands-on help, advice on best practices and execute code reviews.

Qualifications:

  • University degree
  • Extensive knowledge of Java, Spring, JSP, JSF, Wicket, SpringMVC, or other (Java) frameworks;
  • Familiar with content management systems and portals;
  • Standards like JSR 168,286/170, REST;
  • Application servers like Tomcat, JBoss;
  • Open source projects such as Lucene, Jetspeed Portal, Hippo CMS, Cocoon, Jackrabbit;
  • knowledge of open source libraries en testing frameworks;
  • agile methodologies like XP and Scrum;
  • Web technologies like AJAX, JavaScript;
  • You are a business savvy person, with a keen eye for new opportunities;
  • good ability to listen and excellent communication skills,;
  • creative and flexible attitude;
  • quick learner with a natural interest in new technologies;
  • helicopter view;
  • desire and ability to mentor and coach internal and external developers;

Our offer:

  • challenging and demanding job with lots of room for initiative and responsibility;
  • International work environment withinin a young and informal company;
  • Part of a small and energetic team;
  • You will have the opportunity to work with colleagues who are the-best-of-the-best in the open source world;

How to apply:

Are you interested in this versatile job? Please sent you resume with your motivational letter to jobs@onehippo.com. If you would like more information you can contact the HR Manager, Linda Neijenhuis 020-5224466.

We’re looking for a Product Engineer to join our team in Madrid. We are seeking an experienced, self motivated person for a new position in Systems Product Engineering. As part of the P.E team, he/she will be responsible for covering engineering issues related to Rooftop & Tracker products installed in Europe. This position will work closely with Product Engineering team in Frankfurt, Germany and Systems & module Product Engineering in US and requires travel to installations in Europe as needed, currently focused on Spain.

Essential Duties and Responsibilitiesinclude the following.

Other duties may be assigned.

    * Engineering support of full range of SunPower System products (Rooftop & Trackers) in Europe
    * Investigate customer complaints, receive customer returns (modules), investigate failures, and provide failure analysis reports
    * Analyze field issues and solve module/ system issues during commissioning process
    * Weekly customer status reporting to Product Engineering in US
    * This position is stationed in Madrid, Spain.

Education, Experience and Qualifications

    * Bachelors degree (B.S. / B.Eng.) in photovoltaic, electrical engineering, energy technologies, power control or related field
    * Ability and proven experience to think creatively learn and develop innovative solutions to electro-mechanical challenges involved with photovoltaic installations. Familiarity with mechanical engineering and civil engineering principles
    * Proven problem solving skills and trouble shooting
    * 3+ years of engineering experience. Experience in PV industry is desirable
    * Self motivated, with ability to work both independently and with multiple teams
    * Strong communication skills – both written and verbal
    * Strong customer focused attitude
    * Fluency in English is required and fluency in European languages is desired (Italian, French and German).

Consulting professionals at Accenture belong to one of three workgroups: Management Consulting, Systems Integration Consulting or Technology Consulting. These workgroups enable us to deliver the increasingly specialized skills that clients demand while providing our people with varied career opportunities.

Our management consultants have the opportunity to work and collaborate with colleagues from across the full spectrum of consulting activity: identifying and creatively solving complex problems, designing and re-engineering critical processes, and fundamentally transforming the way a company operates. Our management consultants are more than just theorists - they turn theory into action. Acting as trusted advisors to our clients, they work directly with FORTUNE© Global 500 companies across many different industry sectors. They concentrate on getting a holistic view of a client's business and industry environment and use their expertise and critical thinking skills to design and deliver realistic, achievable business strategies and solutions that address key client priorities.

Much of the work we do is at the cutting edge of innovation and thinking. We involve our consultants in publishing and sharing this knowledge as thought leadership to benefit clients, industry and fellow colleagues.

Supply Chain & Operations professionals help clients develop strategies and operating models that integrate planning, procurement, product design, manufacturing and fulfillment functions within an organization, as well as connect suppliers and customers across the extended supply chain.

As a Management Consulting Consultant, you will be at the core of understanding and responding to our clients' business challenges. You are likely to be involved in a range of activities from assessing a client's business capabilities to conducting business transformation activities.

The Department of Industry, Trade and Tourism of the BASQUE GOVERNMENT (Spain) has set up a programme designed to recruit professionals and to enhance the international profile of Basque Companies.​ The programme includes a period of training in Spain (6-12 months) for the successful candidate with the possibility of on-going work in USA, once the training period has been completed.​

REQUIREMENTS:

  • University Degree
  • Applicants must not have received any grant of similar characteristics
  • USA passport and residence in Philadelphia or its surroundings area
  • Applicants must not have received any previous grants of a similar nature
  • A good level of Spanish will be appreciated

DESCRIPTION OF THE COMPANY:

TierraSolar is a Spanish electrical engineering and construction firm with over 10 years experience in the execution of "Turnkey" installations from solar energy in those areas in which it works (solar energy, both photovoltaic and thermal, and geothermal).

Tierra Solar´s core business is the design and development
full service in developing solar energy projects of various areas: fields of power generation (solar farms), Industrial Sector, Agricultural Sector, Construccion sector (housing construction, industrial facilities)

TierraSolar has extensive experience in solar photovoltaic installations on roof in industrial facilities (5 to 600kW) and solar farms (several megawatts). The company has installed and producing more than 7 MW in the entire Iberian Peninsula and has developed several important projects, such as undertaking the first solar farm in the Basque Country, with a capacity of 2 MW.

EuropaBio (www.europabio.org) is the political voice of the biotechnology industry in Europe. The association has 66 corporate members operating worldwide, 7 associates, 4 regions and 22 national biotechnology associations representing more than 1800 SMEs companies in Europe. The corporate members have a wide range of activities: Human and animal health care, diagnostics, bio-informatics, chemicals, crop protection, agriculture, food & environmental products & services. The Green (Agricultural) Biotechnology Europe (GBE) unit of EuropaBio represents those members that have activities and interests in the application of biotechnology to the plant sector.

Your challenge

As Political Relations Manager - Green Biotechnology, you will - in close cooperation with the whole GBE structure – develop and implement the legislative and political strategy for crop biotechnology in Europe. You will proactively build and maintain the necessary network of open, transparent and informative relationships with key stakeholders and with regulators from the European institutions, with a particular focus on communicating with the European Parliament. You will proactively contribute to defining and implementing the necessary tools that further the objectives of the industry.

Your key skills

  • an academic background in either a science or policy-based discipline,
  • a minimum of 4 years experience in the Brussels policy-making environment,
  • a thorough and in depth understanding of EU policy and processes
  • demonstrable experience in developing, implementing and proactively leading an EU legislative campaign in all its facets
  • a strong network of relevant contacts in EU institutions (Commission, Council, Parliament),
  • be an effective team player with a good track record of facilitating consensus within groups
  • multilingual, with strong spoken and written English,

EuropaBio offers

A senior position in a challenging and stimulating environment and the opportunity to work within a motivated and professional team of experts within an innovative, multinational association; direct interaction with companies that are recognized leaders in agricultural biotechnology; an attractive remuneration package that reflect the importance of this Brussels-based position.
National Energy Solutions Project Development Consultant

Johnson Controls is a world class employer where ingenuity and excellence are welcome. We are a global market leader in automotive experience, building efficiency and power solutions with over 140,000 employees in 125 countries. For over a century, Johnson Controls has been working to find new ways to improve the places where people live, work and travel, which in turn gives our employees the chance to change the world.
National Energy Solutions Project Development Consultant

RESPONSIBILITY LEVEL:

Under minimal direction, provides consultation and project development oversight of the Project Development Team to achieve department and project objectives on large, complex, high-risk projects. Develops project development processes and engineering tools, implements the project development process, integrates and analyses technical, financial and legal information to determine project viability and certifies conformance to all code and regulatory requirements  Conducts appropriate research for unique applications,  supports engineering, process or financial tasks during both preliminary and detailed development of projects.  Supports the team in achieving business goals by following and expanding the Solutions Playbook and Best Business Practices methodology. Responsibility to establish an ongoing partnership with the customer on assigned projects.  Leads & mentors Project Development Engineers III, II or I.

SPECIFIC DESIRABLE PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE:
 Responsible professional engineer who has sealed drawings and specifications for institutional buildings such as hospitals, higher education facilities and industrial plants for the following systems:

  • Chilled water plants between 2,000 and 10,000 tons
  • Heating hot water systems between 10 and 50 mmbtu/hr
  • Steam systems between 10 and 50 mmbtu/hr
  • Biomass steam generation system between 20 and 100 mmbtu/hr

 Familiarity with power generation systems including but not limited to:

  • Back pressure steam turbine generators
  • Condensing steam turbine generators
  • Natural gas fueled reciprocating engine generators
  • Diesel fueled reciprocating engine generators

Familiarity with economic analysis of Central Utility Plant on a life-cycle-cost basis.

Renewable energy is needed now more than ever and solar is poised to make a significant and cost effective contribution.​ We are certified “green” solar integrators and one of the fastest growing privately held companies in the San Francisco Bay Area.​ Sun Light & Power’s core management and innovative team have a strong interest in sustainable living with a passion to make a difference in the world, now and for our children’s future.​

Sun Light and Power is seeking an experienced and motivated sales person to sell commercial and residential solar. This fulltime sales person will promote solar, answer technical questions about solar, close deals, and treat every client with respect while providing a high level of quality and service.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and build a network of customers in the residential, commercial, and government sectors.
  • Conduct sales and proposal presentations to clients.
  • Sales follow through on new and existing leads of clients.
  • Site analysis (shadings, measurements, assessments).
  • Analysis of client’s electrical usage, system sizing.
  • Development of sales database and marketing programs.
  • Attend company meetings, outings, Green Expos, conferences, fairs, and other related company and industry events.
  • Meet sales targets.
  • Other duties related to solar sales.

Work Environment/ Arrangements:

  • Individual will work remotely.
  • Access to reliable phone and internet connections a must.

Engineering & Manufacturing company is looking to add a Product Manager to their Sales & Marketing division. You need a BS degree in Engineering or Marketing and 5+ years of product marketing experience supporting a renewable energy product (wind or solar preferred). Our client offers an excellent opportunity, compensation, bonus and relocation assistance.

Responsibilities

  • Close coordination with all the key functions of the company – sales, quality, manufacturing and technology
  • Develop & execute a detailed product road map as well as business cases in support of new product developments or new market entries
  • Maintain & develop a competitive product portfolio including products and features which support the company's value proposition
  • Updating trade literature and marketing databases with latest product information
  • All customer-facing product documentation including content generation, input briefs, proof approval and publication
  • Focal point for all customer inquiries on product issues, daily support to key account managers on product specific issues

Requirements

  • 5+ years of product marketing experience supporting a renewable energy product
  • Solid understanding of sales, regulatory & certification compliance, quality standards, manufacturing capabilities and technology development
  • Intimate knowledge of all aspects of the product (technical & non-technical)
  • A clear understanding of market economics, including the cost and performance of the product
  • You need a successful track record managing a product portfolio

The company is a family of businesses on the leading edge of design and technology in product and process. Their leadership in design, innovation and technology has positioned their brands as some of the most recognized in the world. Their products are engineered for quality and designed to deliver years of performance. They re-invest 90% of earnings back into the business every year.

This company has manufacturing sites and distributes it products worldwide. Their many charitable contributions improve educational opportunities for children and preserves communities where they have office and manufacturing facilities. Career development is fostered through continued education, frequent skills training and open, robust succession planning. The company provides on site virtual e-learning programs, classroom courses and hands-on training opportunities for employees around the world. The company believes in making careful hiring decisions and growing from within whenever possible.

THE OPPORTUNITY

– This very high profile manufacturer has a career building opening for a Marketing Manager – Alternative Energy. You will be the company’s marketing expert relative to Alternative Energy product lines and the Alternative Energy business. Markets include utilities, wind, switch gear, smart grid, battery and more efficient methods of using fossil fuels. This is a senior level role that will be very involved with “C” level leadership. You will have ownership of margin managemenr, product development, product management, pricing, promotions, marketing communication and field communication. The organization will look to you to drive the development of profitable growth strategies, new product schedules and marketing plans to deliver on the objectives of the business. This is a leading edge opportunity to assist an already successful company in the power business expand into alternative and renewable energy fields. Specific responsibilities include development of product and technology road maps; track competition; assess voice of customer; establish annual strategic and tactical business plans around key opportunities; identify key vertical markets and customer targets; new product development and launch planning.

The position reports to the Senior Director of Alternative Power Products. This senior leader believes in providing people with clear direction, the right tools and then getting out of their way. He likes open dialogue and assertive ideas. He respects others opinions. No “yes” people allowed. Independent thinkers and doers welcomed.  He likes people to tell him why they may not agree and why. Their idea may be better than his and he respects that. He is an Electrical Engineer with a Masters degree and has been with the company for 8 years, all of which have been involved with power products.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR IN A CANDIDATE 

  • Four year technical or business degree
  • Pricing and margin management experience
  • Direct experience with phase gate new product development processes
  • Has worked with power products in a manufacturing environment
  • Willing to travel up 25% to 35% within North America
  • Experience engaging with and leading cross-functional teams

This position includes a six-figure income opportunity, guaranteed first year bonus, full relocation and corporate benefits.

Fueled by a dedicated workforce, Ameresco is the premier provider of energy efficiency and renewable technology solutions.​ From conservation to renewable energy generation, our employees have developed and implemented over $4 Billion in energy savings solutions that help our customers utilize clean and sustainable resources.​

We currently seek Project Engineers with energy efficiency and renewable technology experience to partner with our Regional Teams to develop and implement energy savings and renewable technology projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Coordinate visits to customer project sites to investigate existing mechanical, electrical, HVAC, and plumbing systems.
  • Gather and document key project site energy performance information, including utility data and facility infrastructure drawings.
  • Perform detailed engineering assessment including baseline profiles, end-use and retrofit analysis.
  • Identify opportunities for conservation or efficiency and prepare energy savings calculations.
  • Assist Project Team with developing and producing proposals, technical reports, cost estimates, and presentations.
  • Provide critical review of proposals and reports through technical narrative editing.
  • Cultivate and maintain positive business relationships.
  • Perform other duties as required.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • BSME or equivalent four year technical engineering degree with proven energy efficiency and/ or renewable technology project development and implementation experience.
  • Ability to analyze and quantify energy savings and implement complex projects involving chiller and boiler plants, motors, VSDs, HVAC retrofit and distributed generation projects.
  • Knowledge of measurement and verification, project cost estimating and accounting desired.
  • Familiarity with building simulation and related software.
  • Financial planning/ budget experience with ability to develop a business case helpful.
  • Professional registration or educational progress toward PE, CEM, LEED.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and computer communication and technical presentation skills.
  • Valid Drivers License in good standing, issued by resident state required.
  • U. S. Citizenship or U. S. Permanent Resident status required.
  • May be required to pass security clearance investigation.
  • Travel may be required.

AMEC Earth & Environmental (AMEC) is a leading full-service environmental engineering and construction/​remediation services firm in North America, providing environmental and geotechnical engineering and scientific consulting services.​

AMEC (LSE: AMEC) is a focused supplier of high-value consultancy, engineering and project management services to the world’s natural resources, nuclear, clean energy, water and environmental sectors. With annual revenues of over £2. 6 billion, AMEC designs, delivers and maintains strategic and complex assets for its customers. AMEC's Natural Resources, Power & Process and Earth & Environmental businesses employ almost 22,000 people in around 40 countries worldwide. AMEC shares are traded on the London Stock Exchange where the company is listed in the Oil Equipment and Services sector (LSE: AMEC. L). www. amec. com . Since 2000, Engineering News Record magazine has ranked AMEC among the top International Design Firms. AMEC has also ranked at the top of its sector in the Dow Jones Sustainability Index since 2005.  

AMEC offers competitive salaries along with a complete benefits package including: medical, vision, & dental coverage, 401K Matching, Educational Reimbursement, and a variety of Training and Development Programs to help you develop the skills you need to succeed in your chosen career path. Additional information can be obtained from our website at www. amec. com.

AMEC Minneapolis Office is the North American hub for the company’s Energy Management Program (EMP), including energy and water auditing services, recommissioning, GHG reduction planning and projects, as well as sustainability planning and implementation for both government (state, local and federal) and private sector clients.   We also maintain a vast network of project management and engineering services to multiple strategic clients throughout North America.   

Our Earth and Environmental team in Minneapolis, which currently consists of 26 professionals, is looking for a Recommissioning Consultant to work with a wide range of clients. The successful candidate will be a member of the Minneapolis EMP team and serve as one of the primary experts on recommissioning projects.

Job Responsibilities:
Preferred candidate will undertake a variety of tasks on energy assessment/ renewable energy projects including and especially recommissioning and HVAC field work. As the primary recommissioning/ retro commissioning expert for the team, the successful candidate will serve as technical lead for work with a variety of clients, public and private.   Candidate will also be responsible for data entry into various software and client databases, written reports of findings and analysis, energy saving calculations, and assessments and findings of trend data. Field work will be a key component of this job and the flexibility to travel locally is strongly preferred; some overnight travel will be required from time to time.

Knowledge/ Experience/ Education
Candidates will possess, at a minimum,

  • BS Mechanical Engineering from an accredited institution
  • PE registration/ license in the State of Minnesota
  • 2 years re/ retro commissioning experience in government and/ or private sector markets
  • Working knowledge of building automation systems and/ or energy management systems
  • Expertise in the use and application of equipment controls, pneumatic and DDC

Hippo is looking for an experienced Quality Assurance Engineer who would like to work in a dynamic and international environment. Do you have a passion for developing great open source software? Do you know what it takes to deliver robust and reliable systems? Can you ensure performance, quality and security aspects while delivering a product that delivers an awesome user experience? Do you love to work in a small team of experienced developers and UI designers? Then this just might be the coolest job in town for you!

We are searching for an experienced QA engineer that is both methodological and creative. As a QA engineer you will help our software team, with your broad knowledge of technologies and frameworks, to make our open source solutions just that little bit better.
Because of the major impact of Open Standards on Content Management & Portal technology, Hippo is actively involved in the specification of several Java Specification Request (JSR) standards. Hippo has a vast number of employees participating in open source projects within the Apache Software Foundation. This role will give you the opportunity to work closely with some open source veterans and to pimp your open source resume.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute test plans and test cases based upon functional and design specifications;
  • Develop and maintain automated test suites;
  • Participate actively in functional, platform and regression testing activities;
  • Work closely with the development team to analyze, debug and resolve issues;
  • Participate in product functional reviews, test specifications and documentation reviews;
  • Runs evaluations effectively and drive the closure of all open issues on time;
  • Able to estimate and perform risk analysis for large features;
  • Organize own tasks and takes responsibility for progress and completion. Understands and manages priorities;
  • Handle 1-2 large tasks as well as a handful of smaller issues at one time;
  • Pro-actively suggests and drives improvements to existing development process;
  • Keep management well-informed and provide status across the organization;
  • Ensures high quality of all development work.

Qualifications:

  • University degree; 
  • 5+ years of software testing experience; 
  • Testing experience with web based applications; 
  • Programming experience with QA tools, e.g. Selenium;
  • Must have a strong knowledge of QA processes and methodologies 
  • Strong working knowledge in Unix/Windows environments; 
  • Familiar with JAVA programming and JavaScript; 
  • Working experience with different types of application servers and web servers, installed on different OS; 
  • Moderate knowledge in writing SQL scripts for RDBMS, e.g. creating a database; 
  • Good attention to detail, you miss nothing;
  • Ability to rise above detail to see broader issues and implications for whole product or team;
  • Utilize analytical skills in determining the root cause of problems;
  • Demonstrates ability to multi-task and re-prioritize responsibilities based on changing requirements (such as urgent customer problems);
  • Excellent problem solving, analytical and technical troubleshooting skills;
  • Fluent in English and door understanding of the Dutch language.

Our offer:

  • Challenging and demanding job with lots of room for initiative and responsibility; 
  • International work environment within a young and informal company; 
  • Part of a small and energetic team; 
  • You will have the opportunity to work with colleagues who are the-best-of-the-best in the open source world.

  How to apply: Are you interested in this versatile job? Please sent you resume with your motivational letter to jobs@onehippo.com. If you would like more information you can contact our Product Manager Stephan Westen, 020-5224466.
